artist: Designer: George Washington Maher; Manufacturer: Gorham Manufacturing Company; Retailer: Spaulding & Company, Chicago, Illinois
creditline: Gift of funds from the Decorative Arts Council with proceeds from the 2005 Antiques Show and Sale
markings: on side of handle, stamped: [Martelé/ (eagle)/ (lion) (anchor) G (?)/ 9584]; on opposite side of handle, stamped: [ZGF/ SPAULDING & CO. CHICAGO]; below blade, stamped: [STERLING]
object_name: Dinner knife, from a twelve-piece place setting, Twelve-piece place setting
portfolio: Designed for Rockledge, the E. L. King House, Homer, MN (demolished 1987)
text: In addition to the coffee and tea service shown here, the extensive silver service for Rockledge included an extensive set of flatware for formal dining.  The Gorham Manufacturing Company produced twelve place settings consisting of twelve pieces each--from dinner knife to coffee spoon.  These also featured the motifs for Rockledge: the King monogram, the flattened arch (here seen on the terminus of each piece), and the tiger lily.
title: Dinner knife, from a twelve-piece place setting
